timeline.description: Leading enterprise Kubernetes platform offering developer and operational efficiencies.

entries.title: Red Hat OpenShift
entries.description: Red Hat OpenShift enhances Kubernetes for enterprise application development and deployment.

timeline.description: Enterprise-grade Linux distribution that provides a robust platform for software development and deployment.

entries.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux
entries.description: RHEL is the world's leading enterprise Linux platform, providing a stable and secure foundation for applications.

timeline.description: Kubernetes-native Java stack that optimizes Java specifically for Kubernetes.

entries.title: Quarkus
entries.description: Quarkus is a full-stack, Kubernetes-native Java framework made for Java virtual machines (JVMs) and native compilation.

timeline.description: A modern open-source JavaScript runtime environment that enables server-side execution of JavaScript.

entries.title: Node.js
entries.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on the V8 engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

timeline.description: Comprehensive security solution designed for Kubernetes environments, providing visibility and enhanced security across cluster configurations and runtime.

entries.title: Advanced Cluster Security
entries.description: Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security for Kubernetes leverages deep, layered security to protect containerized applications, from build and deploy to runtime.

timeline.description: End-to-end management solution for Kubernetes clusters, facilitating multi-cluster management, governance, and automation in hybrid cloud environments.

entries.title: Advanced Cluster Management
entries.description: Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes provides visibility and control across various cloud environments with policy-driven governance and automation.

timeline.description: A comprehensive API management platform that allows users to control, secure, distribute, and monetize their APIs.

entries.title: 3scale API Management
entries.description: Red Hat 3scale API Management enables control and visibility over APIs, offering analytics, access control, and monetization tools.

timeline.description: A reliable, scalable, and high-performance messaging system.

entries.title: Red Hat AMQ
entries.description: Red Hat AMQ offers a variety of messaging technologies to handle communication and integration among applications and services.

timeline.description: A robust platform providing enterprise-level automation solutions, combining different Ansible capabilities into a unified offering.

entries.title: Ansible Automation Platform
entries.description: Ansible Automation Platform integrates Ansible's simplicity and flexibility with advanced features to scale and operationalize IT automation.

timeline.description: An open-source automation tool that simplifies cloud provisioning, configuration management, application deployment, and many other IT needs.

entries.title: Ansible
entries.description: Ansible is a powerful automation tool that enables organizations to automate complex IT workflows with ease.

timeline.description: A scalable, distributed storage system designed to handle large amounts of data efficiently, reliably, and quickly.

entries.title: Red Hat Ceph Storage
entries.description: Red Hat Ceph Storage is an open, massively scalable, and flexible storage solution for modern workloads like cloud infrastructure, data analytics, media repositories, and backup and restore systems.

timeline.description: A systems management tool that helps manage Red Hat environments and infrastructure efficiently.

entries.title: Red Hat Satellite
entries.description: Red Hat Satellite offers a unified management platform for Red Hat environments, providing provisioning, remote management, and monitoring capabilities.

timeline.description: Facilitates seamless service connectivity across hybrid cloud environments.

entries.title: Red Hat Service Interconnect
entries.description: Service Interconnect by Red Hat enables secure, efficient, and scalable connections across diverse environments, simplifying hybrid cloud integrations.

timeline.description: An enterprise-grade container registry service designed for storing, sharing, and deploying container images.

entries.title: Red Hat Quay
entries.description: Red Hat Quay is a private container registry that stores, builds, and deploys container images, featuring robust security, build automation, and more.

timeline.description: An open source cloud computing platform for creating, deploying, and managing Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS).

entries.title: Red Hat OpenStack Platform
entries.description: Red Hat OpenStack Platform provides a scalable and secure foundation for building a private or public cloud, offering extensive flexibility and control.

timeline.description: A middleware platform for building, deploying, and hosting highly-transactional Java applications.

entries.title: Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform
entries.description: JBoss EAP provides an innovative modular, cloud-ready architecture, powerful management and automation, and world class developer productivity.

timeline.description: Provides predictive analytics and real-time insights into the health of your IT infrastructure.

entries.title: Red Hat Insights
entries.description: Red Hat Insights enables proactive risk management with predictive analytics and real-time intelligence, helping to identify and remediate threats to ensure stability and efficiency.

timeline.description: A comprehensive AI/ML platform that facilitates the development, deployment, and management of AI/ML projects directly on OpenShift.

entries.title: OpenShift AI
entries.description: OpenShift AI integrates AI/ML workflows seamlessly into OpenShift, enabling data scientists and developers to collaborate efficiently and leverage the power of AI/ML at scale.

timeline.description: Python is widely recognized for its simplicity and readability, making it popular for scripting, automation, and data analysis in DevOps.

entries.title: Python
entries.description: Python's extensive library support and its prevalence in automation, data analysis, and machine learning make it a staple in the DevOps toolkit.

timeline.description: Go, designed for system programming, excels in building simple, reliable, and efficient software, making it a favorite for DevOps tools and applications.

entries.title: Go
entries.description: Go's strong concurrency model and efficient compilation have led to its adoption in server-side applications, CLI tools, and infrastructure programming in DevOps.

timeline.description: Ruby, especially with frameworks like Rails, is known for its productivity and ease of use, which extends to automation and configuration tasks in DevOps.

entries.title: Ruby
entries.description: Ruby's readability and expressive syntax, along with a strong ecosystem of tools, make it a solid choice for development and automation in DevOps contexts.

timeline.description: Bash is ubiquitous in Linux environments and is essential for scripting and task automation in Unix-like systems, a cornerstone of DevOps operations.

entries.title: Bash
entries.description: Bash scripting is fundamental for system administration, deployment scripts, and automating routine tasks, making it indispensable in DevOps.

timeline.description: JavaScript's versatility allows it to be used for both client-side and server-side applications, including automation and tooling in DevOps workflows.

entries.title: JavaScript
entries.description: With its widespread use in web development and beyond, JavaScript also finds a place in building DevOps pipelines, particularly in environments relying on Node.js.

timeline.description: A high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

entries.title: Django
entries.description: Django makes it easier to build web applications quickly and with less code. It's known for its robustness and is widely used in the industry.

timeline.description: The web framework for perfectionists with deadlines, Django enables building high-performing, elegant web applications quickly.

entries.title: Ruby on Rails
entries.description: Ruby on Rails is a server-side web application framework written in Ruby. It's a model-view-controller (MVC) framework, providing default structures for a database, a web service, and web pages.

timeline.description: A web application framework for Node.js, designed for building web applications and APIs.

entries.title: Express.js
entries.description: Express.js is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework, providing a robust set of features for web and mobile applications.

timeline.description: A PHP framework for web artisans, focusing on elegance, simplicity, and readability.

entries.title: Laravel
entries.description: Laravel is a web application framework with expressive, elegant syntax. It aims to make the development process a pleasing one for the developer without sacrificing application functionality.

timeline.description: A comprehensive framework for building enterprise-grade Java applications, now embracing reactive programming.

entries.title: Spring Framework
entries.description: The Spring Framework provides a comprehensive programming and configuration model for modern Java-based enterprise applications - on any kind of deployment platform.
